hero.subtitle: Driven engineer passionate about bridging hardware and software. Specialized in embedded systems and IoT architectures.

about.heading: About Me
about.subheading: A journey of passion, innovation, and continuous learning
paragraphs: I'm Zaineb Chakroun, an ambitious and imaginative engineer with a focus on Embedded Systems and IoT. Over the course of my studies and experiences, I've built a solid background in system design, electronics, and software integration.

Driven by curiosity, I love understanding how things work and turning that knowledge into concrete technological solutions. From designing intelligent devices to building connected IoT ecosystems, I tackle every challenge with rigor, creativity, and determination. For me, technology shouldn't just function, it should inspire. Every project I take on is a new chance to innovate, automate, and make everyday life smarter.

projects.heading: Featured Projects
projects.subheading: Showcasing innovative solutions and creative implementations

items.title: IdentiPass
items.description: A secure multi-technology authentication system leveraging QR codes and Mifare Ultralight C NFC cards, supported by a J2EE backend and an Android/Kotlin application.
items.longDescription: Design and development of an innovative authentication solution combining signed QR codes and Mifare Ultralight C NFC cards. The system integrates an Android Kotlin application for credential reading, a secure Java EE backend with REST APIs, and a comprehensive web administration interface. Implementation of advanced security mechanisms including HMAC-SHA256 signatures, password attempt limiting, and centralized access management. A modular architecture enabling flexible and robust authentication for both physical and logical access control. This end-to-end solution demonstrates modern secure development practices across mobile, backend, and web technologies.

items.title: Simon Says
items.description: An embedded Simon Says game implementation using STM32 and LCD display for interactive memory challenges.
items.longDescription: A complete memory game system built from scratch, integrating embedded programming, real-time control, and interactive user interface. The system uses STM32 for core game logic and LED sequence control, push buttons for player input, and an I2C LCD display for instructions and feedback. The project also incorporates difficulty selection and progressive complexity with visual and timing challenges. Features include multiple difficulty levels, score tracking, and smooth LED animations that create an engaging gaming experience.

items.title: Intelligent Monitoring and Detection Systems
items.description: An AI-powered patient monitoring system using embedded vision and real-time audio analysis for medical emergency detection.
items.longDescription: A comprehensive healthcare monitoring solution built from scratch, integrating computer vision, deep learning, and IoT connectivity. The system uses Raspberry Pi 3 with USB cameras for real-time video analysis, YOLOv8 and MediaPipe for fall and seizure detection, and custom audio models for scream detection. The project implements Firebase Cloud Firestore for real-time alerts, a dedicated mobile application for healthcare staff notifications, and GPIO-controlled LED indicators for immediate visual feedback. This end-to-end system provides continuous patient monitoring without wearable devices, ensuring rapid emergency response in clinical environments.
